column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity|identifier|value
#T_CH=de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.coref.type.CoreferenceLink|referenceRelation|referenceType
#Text=Aang says : " Hey , Sokka , you should hear some of these stories .
#Text=But where we have n't been , we 've heard about through stories and songs .
#Text=" Aang says : " They said they 'll take us to see a giant night crawler !
#Text=" Moku says : " On the way , there 's a waterfall that creates a never - ending rainbow !
#Text=" Sokka says : " Look , I hate to be the wet blanket here , but since Katara is busy , I guess it 's up to me .
#Text=" Sokka says : " We need to get to Omashu .
#Text=No sidetracks , no worms and definitely no rainbows .
#Text=" Chong says : " Wow , sounds like someone has a case of destination fever .
#Text=You 're worried too much about where you 're going .
#Text=" Lily says : " You got to focus less on the " where " and more on the " going " .
#Text=" Sokka says : " O. Ma .
#Text=Shu !
#Text=" Katara says : " Sokka 's right .
#Text=We need to find King Bumi , so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe .
#Text=" Chong says : " Sounds like you 're headed to Omashu .
#Text=" Chong says : " There 's an old story about a secret pass right through the mountains .
#Text=" Katara says : " Is this real or a legend ?
#Text=" Chong says : " Oh , it 's a real legend .
#Text=And it 's as old as earthbending itself .
#Text=Two lovers , forbidden from one another , the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart !
#Text=Built a path to be together !
#Text=Yeah , I forget the next couple of lines , but then it goes ... Secret tunnel !
#Text=Secret tunnel !
#Text=Through the mountains , secret , secret , secret , secret tunnel !
#Text=Yeah !
#Text=" Sokka says : " I think we 'll just stick with flying .
#Text=We 've dealt with the Fire Nation before .
#Text=We 'll be fine .
#Text=" Aang says : " Yeah , thanks for the help , but Appa hates going underground .
#Text=And we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable ... "
